body: @lovelle I think it makes more sense to use jcip-annotations for the public api for better documentation. for internally, I am not sure because most of the entities at broker and clients are thread-safe and but it might be helpful for developers if we come across with such apis that requires explicit documentation.

@merlimat can you review this PR?

> LGTM. Out of curiosity, don't we already limit integration tests to be run 1 per node?

I haven't checked that. Though I'm seeing many integration jobs failing for this. Eg. https://builds.apache.org/job/pulsar_precommit_integrationtests/5952/testReport/junit/org.apache.pulsar.tests.integration.functions/PulsarFunctionsThreadTest/pulsar_test_suite/
It could also be related to some container left there. In general, I think testcontainers is using randomized names for all other containers, but just in this case we're using a fixed name.

PTAL @merlimat thanks

@HaraldGustafsson @sijie @merlimat ,
Hi, I made a pr https://github.com/apache/pulsar/pull/3398/ for this issue , tried to add a zknode for mutex(to be honest, it's only a short way like queue size is one, could not a best way).

Right now, what I think we could have 2 other ways to do **retry** thing except this one:
- 1, use zk sequential node for a queue to do retry , could be smarter to do retry but more logics in code , like check the sequence of request.
- 2, use simple retry like sleep a while and retry until the timeout , but cant guarantee grant order is same as the request order .

any ideas ?  thanks

found another two places would have same issues like **PulsarBrokerStarter.java**, 
shall I update them in the same time with a new issue for all of them ?

- 1, https://github.com/apache/pulsar/blob/master/pulsar-discovery-service/src/main/java/org/apache/pulsar/discovery/service/server/DiscoveryServiceStarter.java#L53

- 2, https://github.com/apache/pulsar/blob/master/pulsar-proxy/src/main/java/org/apache/pulsar/proxy/server/ProxyServiceStarter.java#L71

When we defined and reviewed the Go client API, this was one of the discussed points. The idea was to keep the API surface as small as possible. 

Would it be an option to add the message id to the returned `error` ? eg: downcast to a ProducerError interface which will contain an optional message id.

@kamal-brill ackId (aka message id) is used for consumer to acknowledge it has received and processed the message. once a message is acknowledged, the message will not be delivered again. You can read the documentation here: http://pulsar.apache.org/docs/en/concepts-messaging/#acknowledgement
@foreversunyao I think if you can fix them at the same pull request, that would be great!

**This issue occurs in my production environment.**

I am trying to force delete the non-partitioned topic.
`./bin/pulsar-admin topics delete persistent://my-tenant/my-namespace/my-topic-test -f`
but it doesn't work. 

finally I restart the consumer  cluster and the producer cluster.
while not restart the brokers.

partitioned topic disappeared, and it's working.

hello @alapha23 @merlimat When I first used [pulsar-client-go], I also encountered the same problem. Unfortunately, `go get` itself has no concept of version control. In go 1.11, go officially supports the function of [go mod](https://github.com/golang/go/wiki/Modules), can solve this problem very well. Can we also consider using it?

@merlimat I meant to enable partioning on the  topic, if the partitioned-topic is overloaded, how to solve it?

Hi! Afaik the default strategy for partitioned topics is round-robin, therefore you shouldn't have just 1 partition with much more load than the rest of the partitions, of course more partitions on a topic would result in a more finer grained load handling if you have enough brokers to handle those partitions.

@tobgu Sorry missed this issue before.

> panic: interface conversion: pulsar.MessageID is mypackage.pulsarMessageID, not *pulsar.messageID

This problem looks like a go type assertion conversion error 

If you are convenient, can you give me the corresponding code?

run java8 Tests
To be clear, this is when I run "bin/pulsar standalone".
#3430  is related
@murong00, Thanks for the help. overall looks good. It would be better add a unit test for this part of changes

Sorry, I should have illustrated the scenario clearly. Suppose this case, I have one topic which has partioning enabled and the routing mode used for publishing messages is key hash. There are some producers and each one is reading the data from a file(the file could be created by other programs by any time, it is named by a incremental number) and publishing the data to the topic. We use file name as the hash key and suppose the load from all files is distributed on the partitioned topics. However, it is possible that some files hashing into one partitioned topic could make the certain topic hot.

BTW, we use key hash as the routing mode is because we want the data in each file is handled in order, so we can not use round-robin mode.
broker side, more or less, when downloading the tar.gz from pulsar's website
